main event: On 3 March 1955 in Pittsfield, Maine, a diamond-shaped, fluid-white object, resembling the size of a basketball at arm's length and giving off bright lights, was observed for approximately 15 minutes at an estimated altitude of 1000 ft.
interesting points: The object's brightness seemed to fluctuate during the observation.
No sound was observed coming from the object.
The conclusion stated that it was inconclusive, probably a balloon, possibly a satellite, aircraft, or astronomical, with insufficient data for evaluation.
A similar case in Detroit, Michigan raised the possibility of the object being Venus, according to the report.
The geolocation and weather conditions at the time of the sighting were detailed for reference.
sighted object: Diamond-shaped, fluid-white object giving off bright lights
